channel.title: Galleries on Nikolai Nekrutenko
channel.description: Recent content in Galleries on Nikolai Nekrutenko

item.title: Snow
item.description: Happy New Year! A major snowstorm recently unleashed its wrath on us, for a grand total of 14in or 35cm of fluffly, dry snow! Here are some of my favorite long exposures from the evening. .jg-entry img { transition: transform .25s ease-in-out !important; } .jg-entry img:hover { transform: scale(1.1); } 35mm f/14 30sec ISO 100" 35mm f/5.6 1.3sec ISO 100"

item.title: Flying RC Jets!
item.description: Here are some pictures of my friends over at @teamsketchyfpv flying some of their planes. Thanks to them for inviting me, I had an absolute blast. Looks like it’s time for me to get an RC jet! And yes, we did keep at least six feet apart.

item.title: The Mostly Maine Trip
item.description: I recently went on a camping/cabining trip with my family around New England, especially Maine. I know there are a lot of photographs, but I really like all of these.

item.title: Around the Garden
item.description: I walked around the garden and garage to see what pictures I could take. Here are the ones that I liked: .jg-entry img { transition: transform .25s ease-in-out !important; } .jg-entry img:hover { transform: scale(1.1); } 35mm f/5.6 0.0012499999720592975sec ISO 100" 35mm f/6.300000190736682 1/200sec ISO 100" 35mm f/5.6 1/320sec ISO 100" 35mm f/5.

item.title: Vacuum Tube Amplifier
item.description: Last night, I was listening to music on a vacuum tube amplifier that I assembled a while back from a kit. I really liked the look of the tubes in dark, they had a very retro aesthetic. Since they glowed in a very gentle orange-red color, they were perfect for a long exposure. Maybe it has to do with the look of these tubes, but I’m convinced that music sounds better on tubes than on a transistor amp.

item.title: Water Lilies & Dragonflies
item.description: Today, I headed down to The Arboretum at Penn State to see what flowers and insects were in store for me. At first, I decided to bring a 35mm macro lens. However, after seeing all of the dragonflies and lilies, I biked home in record time and snagged a telephoto lens. I present to you the Water lilies and Dragonflies at The Arboretum at Penn State.

item.title: Solstice Fun
item.description: I went camping with my family in the beautiful Northern PA countryside, near the finger lakes. To celebrate the longest day of the year, I found a stick about my height and lit both ends of it on fire. It was similar to the staff that I use in Tang Soo Do, so I messed around with various techniques. Particularly, I really enjoy doing the figure-eight technique where you essentially spin the stick in the shape of an infinity sign.
